policies.description: Policies from the cached diff. This attribute enables the user to make changes to the diffs that he can post for rollback.

id.description: Id of the cached diff. Use id in the post api if you don't want to make any modifications to the diff corresponding to the diff id.

operations.description: The operations in that version. (policy-add, policy-update, policy-delete)

allPoliciesDeleted.description: Flag to indicate if all policies are deleted in the policy scope

numberOfAssignedApplications.description: The number of assigned applications in the policy

numberOfDevices.description: The number of devices in the policy scope

lastUpdateTime.description: Last update time of the policy

applicationsStale.description: Flag to indicate if applications are stale in the policy

serviceProviderProfileStale.description: Flag to indicate if Service Provider Profiles are stale in the policy scope

bandwidthProfileStale.description: Flag to indicate if Bandwidth Profile associated with the policy is stale

clientReference.description: clientReference (can be used by the client as a reference to this resource

createTime.description: time at which the version was created

policyChanged.description: true if the version was created as a result of put/post/delete on the policy

raw.description: Either raw Application of the form port:protocol should be specified or appId should be specified

stale.description: Indicates whether the application has been updated since the last time this policy was provisioned

trafficClasses.description: Traffic classes to set the bandwidth profile for. If the ActionProperty is BandwidthProfileId, this resource should be 'ALL_TRAFFIC_CLASSES'. Otherwise, it should be null.

Not Authorized Yet, Credentials to be supplied

operations.summary: Return total count of policies

operations.notes: This will return the list of policies diffs for a given version and scope. Each element will be a wrapper on existing policy type and existing application type. The policy wrapper in addition to policy will have an operation enum (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE). CREATE means the policy existed on the selected version but does not exist in the current version. DELETE means the policy did not exist in the selected version but exists in the current version. UPDATE means the policy exists in both versions. Application wrapper has the same semantics for CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Retrieve policy diffs for the given version

parameters.name: policyScope
parameters.description: Retrieve policy diffs for the given scope

parameters.name: scopeWirelessSegment
parameters.description: Retrieve policy diffs for the given scopeWirelessSegment

responseMessages.message: This user is Forbidden Access to this Resource
Not Authorized Yet, Credentials to be supplied

operations.summary: Retrieves the policy diff

operations.notes: The body of the request will contain a list of policy wrappers as obtained by the GET /policy/diff api for a given version. This request will create and apply a new version of the policies. Id and policies in VersionDiffDTO are optional params. But one of them have to be specified. If policies is specified id is ignored.

parameters.description: VersionDiff
